events.message: We have received the application for the software engineer role from the candidate, and the resume looks promising with relevant experience in backend development.
The candidate's application has been categorized under Engineering, as it includes strong software development skills and relevant technologies.
A recruiter has been assigned to the candidate to facilitate communication and to begin scheduling the initial screening for the engineering position.
The initial screening call was completed successfully; the candidate demonstrated strong coding fundamentals and clear communication skills.
Candidate responded promptly confirming availability for a technical interview and expressed enthusiasm about the opportunity to join the engineering team.
The technical interview has been scheduled for next week to assess the candidateâ€™s skills in system design and problem-solving related to backend services.
The candidate completed the technical interview with positive feedback from the panel, showcasing strong expertise in distributed systems and software architecture.
An HR interview has been scheduled to discuss cultural fit, benefits, and company policies with the candidate following the successful technical interview.
The HR interview was completed and the candidate showed good alignment with company values and strong motivation to contribute to the engineering team.
An offer has been proposed to the candidate including competitive salary and benefits tailored for the engineering role they applied for.
The candidate provided positive feedback on the offer and expressed eagerness to accept pending a few clarifications on the onboarding process.
The candidate has officially accepted the offer and is excited to start as a software engineer with the company.
Onboarding has begun with the new hire receiving necessary access, equipment, and introductory training for their engineering role.
The hiring process is now complete with the candidate fully onboarded and added to the engineering department with great expectations.
